sub_title: artist, creative thinker, expert on Haute Couture skills, community art, sustainable textile, surface design, eco plantdyeing
summary:
After taking a bit of time due to covid19 I decided for a change. The studio selling ecological and organic materials is closed now. And I only teach for a special project now and than. You can read more on my new website www.marijkebongers.com 

Plans for 2022: 
-Fashion activism, I have an online zoom group to support each other to recycle and mend. Using textile and clothes as a voice. Set ourselves free from the fashion industry, make storytelling clothes. /creating dreamscapes of a new way to live with our clothes. This year the theme is New Opulence. Making beauty from all the heaps of clothes and textile and making steps back to local materials. 
-Working on an exhibition at the Castellum Hoge Woerd spring and summer
I rework my collection, make a lot of samples in plantdyed materials and will have a textile lab. Also there will probably be two installations in the pluktuin. 
-I joined a citizens science project about old dye books of the Textielmuseum Tilburg (exhibition and workshops from April)
-And I work on the rebranding of Indigo Fashion nl making together with the owner Caroline Nijland a plan for her collection made of Indigo and mudcloth fabric from West-Africa with a handmade Dutch touch. The collection will contain some unique items to wear and for the home. We will present the collection in June on Xtant at Mallorca

projects.title: project about roots and threads
projects.description:
onderzoek voor nieuw kunstproject in Gorcums Museum-Gorinchem ik recycle ideeen over wortels en draden. Opnieuw gaan ontdekken wat er nog meer kan met wilgen en wol...nu al helemaal blij met ideeen die op zijn plaats vallen! In maart is de expositie in Gorinchem
http://www.pinterest.com/marijkebongers/a-project-about-roots-and-threads/

projects.title: THIS IS OUR NATURE
projects.description:
In the child art project THIS IS OUR NATURE AREFS taide ja kulttuuri ry has started with local partners developing an innovative art and culture program to be executed by regional artists with international experiences.
This art and culture program will strengthen the rural roots of children and youth, and will prepare them for a strong future in Europe with respect for their origin.
The art projects will also engage the public in environmental awareness and action and help the population understand its relationship with the environment, the region and local know-how.

profile_positions.description:
For fashion academy students and small susainable start-ups. I can help with my years of practical experience. I like to focus on your personal questions.
I am working on on- and offline lessons and workshops. I train fashion interns (if I have a spot available) and I mentor small start-ups one at a time.
Please contact me for more info.
lets be rebel's in Fashion!

Marijke Bongers
profile_positions.title: expert on Haute Couture skills, sustainable textile, eco plantdyeing and designer/trainer

profile_positions.description:
After a really successful summer in the museum we decided to make some changes with the studio. 
We now go back to our first love and design and make fair, organic, unique bespoke (bridal)wear. We make them so that they can be plant dyed by us and we make them in separate pieces so you can wear these precious clothes for a long long time. We will show these outfits at 6th October at the Fair Fashion Festival in Utrecht (the Netherlands)
We also work on the Kimono-project in a group of talented women we invited to work with. "The Conscious Women Society" We make kimono coats that you can wear at two sides with personal quotes or decoration in embroidery or other technics. The first coat was handspun and handwoven by Caitlin Bongers, and I (Marijke Bongers) sewed it all by hand and lined it with hand dyed organic, fair and cruelty free silk. Two other coats are worked on right now. One with the hand weaver Mieke de Bruijn. The yarns are mostly spun by Caitlin again, and I will sew it together and do the embroidery.
Next to that we want our studio to be a place of inspiration and a place where you can still buy fair, organic or very special materials. We test them all ourselves.
In our classes we can teach you old skills like sewing, embroidery, knitting, plant dyeing, crochet and spinning.
It is also possible to make your own fair organic (bridal)outfit with a bit of help. We think it is possible if you let us help you with fittings and more. This makes fair, organic and bespoke so much more available and might add to the value you give too your clothes.
Please have a look at our website: www.ecotextilestudio.com
In the link you can find our book with pictures of the last photoshoot. The model is Nienke Wind of Introdans and the photographer is Timon Both Fotografie.
profile_positions.title: Fashion Designer

profile_positions.description: We make bespoke, organic, fair, plantdyed and crueltyfree (bridal)outfits. Teach workshops and classes and sell the materials we work with.
profile_positions.title: Designer

profile_positions.description:
2018 proposal for a commission for two interactive textile installations with threads for the "Huis van Inspiratie" a cooperation between cultural institutes in Gorinchem for the exhibition on embroidery in the museum of the city. 

2017-now:
I do a small project in my village about mending clothes, for the "deelcafe de Buurman" we asked on Facebook for a sewing machine and got two of them now from people of the village. I write little articles to promote the group of women that are knitting and come together on Thursday afternoon weekly. Everybody who have no sewing machine or just like to mend clothes with a little help and company is invited to come and do it at the group. To show and invite people to use it I work every Thursday for a little while on the sewing machines and I repair my own clothes there.
http://www.deelcafedebuurman.nl/

October 2012 cooperation with Amsterdam based artist Mariska Mell in the project "ministerie van revitalisering" research and product design for Dutch wool that is now trown away.
Also preparing for the project by Mariska Mell "in de bovenkamer" a cooperation between an artist, a chef and a musician to serve a very special meal to the visitors. Working with leftover wool and wood gathered in my local neighbourhood.
June 2012 :member of the Artisfabriek, an Amsterdam based group of artists, based on the Bauhaus concept.

profile_positions.description:
I worked on  my installation "Whisperspot" for the Labyrint next to the  International artcentre.
It was part of the symposium FINNISH FOREST - SOURCE OF ART http://www.saksala.org/symposiums/symposium-2008/symposium-installation-labyrinth-project-3-01.htm
profile_positions.title: artist

company.name: Eco Textile Studio (name change from Sweet and Simple STuff)

profile_positions.company: Eco Textile Studio (name change from Sweet and Simple STuff)
profile_positions.description: As an artist I work with textile in nature. This made me investigate the environmental and social issues involved to choose materials to work with. Like fashion a lot of craft textile is not an ethical choice. Next to this I visited an art centre in Finland and realised that like in Finland, craftsmanship and little shops with materials disappeared quick in our own village too. This led to the decision to have open studio on Friday and Saturdays. On those days we sell eco friendly and fairtrade yarns and textiles. The rest of the week I work on patterns, develop new possibilities with old technics give classes and write tutorials. Read further on our website    www.ecotextilestudio.nl
profile_positions.title: eco textile designs, we sell eco-yarns and -textiles on Friday and Saturday

profile_positions.description: I try to find new ways to use old textiles and raw wool and to make it available to Academy Students and DIY lovers.
